page.title: 02Setting the Scene.
page.content: The land between{Harehope}in the west, {Bannamoor}in the east, and south to {Beanley}is mainly arable with a small amount of woodland. Most of the male population work on the land.The hounds of the{Percy}and{Milvain Hunts}are kennelled at{Beanley.}The village of{ {Eglingham}itself has a church, school and Post Office.Although the latter sells groceries it is recorded as P.O. only on the survey grid. There is also a public house,The Tankerville Arms. At one time there was another,The Ogle Arms, but this is now a private house. There is a village hall, a market garden specialising in rockery plants, a farm in the centre of the village and about thirty-five houses in addition to Eglingham Hall, part of which is now let as flats.
